did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Methodist Episcopal Church of Eden records, 1830-1897.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Methodist Episcopal Church of Eden (Eden, N.Y.)

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: A preprinted register of probationers' records; class lists; membership lists; pastoral and statistical records; baptisms and marriages (1830-1897). Miscellaneous documents relating primarily to the formation of the church (1830-1881).

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: A Methodist class was organized by Dr. William Hill in Eden during the winter of 1812-1913. In 1830 plans for building a meeting house were made and a lot was donated by John Hill. The church was officially incorporated and trustees were elected in 1831, the year the building was completed. Another building, begun in 1855 and completed in 1858, replaced the old building.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: Not to be published or otherwise released in such form that any individual mentioned in the records can be identified.
